description:
doc/install: Move discussion of GOROOT when using tarballs to a subsection.

Some people are still being confused because the GOROOT instructions come
before those for the default install path. Hopefully reversing the order
and adding a heading will clear up any remaining confusion.

Also removed the bit about setting environment variables in Windows since
that is already covered in the Windows section.

messages.text:
Hello adg@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

On 2013/07/17 06:21:27, kisielk wrote:
> Hello mailto:adg@golang.org (cc: mailto:golang-dev@googlegroups.com),
> 
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://code.google.com/p/go

Sadly I don't think this is going to be enough. It's certainly an improvement, don't get be wrong. But I can easily see someone who isn't actually reading the text (a common problem) just copy & pasting the grey sections.

My counter suggestion would be 

a. remove this section entirely
b. banish it to the bottom of the page
c. move it to the wiki

On 2013/07/17 06:26:22, dfc wrote:
> On 2013/07/17 06:21:27, kisielk wrote:
> > Hello mailto:adg@golang.org (cc: mailto:golang-dev@googlegroups.com),
> > 
> > I'd like you to review this change to
> > https://code.google.com/p/go
> 
> Sadly I don't think this is going to be enough. It's certainly an improvement,
> don't get be wrong. But I can easily see someone who isn't actually reading the
> text (a common problem) just copy & pasting the grey sections.
> 
> My counter suggestion would be 
> 
> a. remove this section entirely
> b. banish it to the bottom of the page
> c. move it to the wiki

I think the section serves a useful purpose, especially for people who need an easy
way to install Go on a machine they don't have root on (eg: shared systems at universities).

Moving the instructions to the wiki would just make it likely that first-time users who
need that would never find them.

So I guess that leaves option b. How about moving the GOROOT instructions for all platform to
a separate section called "Installing to a non-standard location" ?
